content.title: Swabhimaan Scheme
content.state: Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
content.beneficiary: Pregnant Women, Lactating Mothers, Adolescent Girls
content.details: The Union Territory of Daman & Diu and Dadra & Nagar Haveli has successfully launched the “Swabhimaan Scheme” scheme to tackle the problems of Malnutrition, Anemia, and other relevant issues. The Hon'ble Prime Minister launched the scheme in Daman on 25th February 2018 and Hon'ble Home Minister in Dadra and Nagar Haveli on 20th April 2018. Under this scheme, a take-home ration (7.5kgs nutritious) is provided every month to Pregnant Women, Lactating Mothers, and Sabla (Adolescent Category girls in the age group of 11-14 years).
benefits: Monthly quota of supplementary nutrition provided to pregnant women, lactating mothers, and adolescent girls.
Items provided in the supplementary nutrition kits are procured from the market through an open and transparent process.
Each item is neatly packed after quality inspection.
Monthly supplementary nutrition provided includes Wheat, Rice, Peanuts, Jaggery, Tur Dal, Roasted Peanuts, Moong Dal, Moong, Oil (Fortified with Vitamin A&D), and Salt (Double Fortified).
eligibility: All the Pregnant Women, Lactating Mothers, and Adolescent Girls (Adolescent Category in the age group of 11-14 years) of the Union Territory of Daman & Diu and Dadra & Nagar Haveli.
exclusions: Women other than Pregnant/Lactating Women & Adolescent Girls.
content.application_process: Offline. Beneficiaries need to visit the nearest Anganwadis Centre or contact the office of the Social Welfare Department, Union Territory of Daman & Diu, and Dadra & Nagar Haveli.

faqs.question: What is the “Swabhimaan Scheme” scheme?
faqs.answer: The Union Territory of Daman & Diu and Dadra & Nagar Haveli has successfully launched the “Swabhimaan Scheme” scheme to tackle the problems of Malnutrition, Anemia, and other relevant issues.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The Hon'ble Prime Minister launched the scheme in Daman on 25th February 2018 and Hon'ble Home Minister in Dadra and Nagar Haveli on 20th April 2018.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: All the Pregnant Women, Lactating Mothers, and Adolescent Girls (Adolescent Category in the age group of 11-14 years) of the Union Territory of Daman & Diu and Dadra & Nagar Haveli are eligible to get the benefits of the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of the Union Territory of Daman & Diu and Dadra & Nagar Haveli?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of the Union Territory of Daman & Diu and Dadra & Nagar Haveli.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the beneficiaries are provided a monthly quota of supplementary nutrition to pregnant women, lactating mothers, and adolescent girls on a fixed day of every month as a take-home ration.

faqs.question: How much ration does the beneficiary get under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Under this scheme, a take-home ration of 7.5 kg of nutritious is given to the eligible beneficiary.

faqs.question: Are all women eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is only for Pregnant/Lactating Women & Adolescent Girls.

faqs.question: Who are Adolescent Girls?
faqs.answer: The girls in the age group of 11-14 years are considered as Adolescent categories under the scheme.

faqs.question: Will the beneficiary get supplementary nutrition every month?
faqs.answer: Yes, monthly supplementary nutrition will be provided to a beneficiary every month.

faqs.question: How can a beneficiary enroll under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To enroll under the scheme, the beneficiaries need to visit the nearest Anganwadis Centre or contact the office of the Social Welfare Department, Union Territory of Daman & Diu, and Dadra & Nagar Haveli.
